Basic Configuration
There are several mandatory requirements to execute a backup:
Action (backup by default)
Mode (fs by default)
Path-to-backup
Backup-name
Container (swift container or local path)
Storage (swift by default) For HP Helion OpenStackÂ® 2.0 Beta 1, a backup using only mandatory values would be as follows: - freezerc --action backup --mode fs --storage swift --path-to-backup /home/user/tmp --container tmp_backups --backup-name backup1 The translation to a configuration file for this backup execution would be as follows:
{ "job_actions": [ { "freezer_action": { "action": "backup", "mode": "fs", "backup_name": "backup1", "path_to_backup": "/home/user/tmp", "container": "tmp_backups" }, "max_retries": 3, "max_retries_interval": 60 } ], "job_schedule": { "schedule_interval": "24 hours" }, "description": "backup for tmp dir" }
In this configuration file (JSON), the freezer command is wrapped in a "freezer_action". All "-" are translated to "_" and the first "--" are omitted. HP Helion OpenStack 2.0 Beta 1, we can define the schedule rules that this job will follow (only available through the configuration file) and a brief description of the job.
